reviewText: Watched this on cable this evening and plan to buy it.  I have never watched NCIS as I think it's farcical.  I understand now from watching this movie that I may have been trying to enjoy NCIS as serious plausible drama when, in fact, if it is seen for the comic farce it is might be quite entertaining.This movie is fun.  I find it endlessly entertaining how women half the cop's age can't wait to , ( self censored ) , with him etc.  Funny beyond words.The plot and characters might have made a serious movie except for the overacting, coincidences, and holes in the storyline.  Not to worry, this is a comedy not serious after all.The final scene ( no spoiler alert needed ) really sums up the tone of the entire movie.....a cult of personality.  I am going to watch a few NCIS episodes now and try to keep in mind that is about as serious as "CSI Miami" which I enjoy for the overacting and sheer foolishness of it.Mahalo.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Mark Harmon does a slight turn from playing Gibbs. He is still the leader of a law enforcement group. Occasional Minneapolis locations made it fun for me. Too often California is used. My laugh out loud moment is the team arriving in the very small Wichita airport. When I saw it on TV you could see the mountains. Here, they have made it a little hazy. I still like the hang the Wichita Airport name banner on the side of the building.The cast is having fun. The story is good. It is a nice movie to spend an evening with. Just don't go in with any blockbuster hopes.

reviewText: The movie is excellent, with a full of herself, sexy, brilliant attorney who believes that she can get away with anything - even murder -only to meet her match in Mark Harmon who gives her her just desserts.  Action packed, good storyline, a villain you love to hate, fast cars and, of course  Mark Harmon as the hero.  Who could ask for more?
summary: Sometimes the lawyers get their just desserts
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was ready to love this movie.  I love Lucas Davenport and I like Mark Harmon.  But when I heard he was cast in this role, I knew he was NOT Lucas.  But I watched the movie and it was awful.  Not just because Harmon is so not Lucas, but also because the acting, and I use the term loosely, was awful.  Even Harmon, whom I love in NCIS and never miss.  I almost could not make it through the movie and would never watch it again.  If you are a huge Harmon fan, and I really like him, and you were not familiar with the books, you might give this a 3 or 4. I cannot understand how anyone could give it a 5, but that is just my opinion and obviously different from some others.  What is so disappointing is that the company that made this movie owns the rights to ALL the Lucas Davenport movies.  I wish the movie-makers would realize that fans of books want their characters and stories to follow the books as closely as possible.  Otherwise, what's the point of basing a movie on a book? Did anyone ask Peter Jackson to make LOTR different from the books?  For the record, I see Lucas as being more like Jim Caviezel or Timothy Oliphant.

reviewText: How is it possible for Mark Harmon to produce such a dud? France just aired this pitiful film on cable. The chemistry between players was dead from the start, a poor cast of talentless individuals who bore you endlessly with empty stares, no acting to speak of, even Mark Harmon was acting like a novice himself. Are you ageing in the wrong direction Mark? Perhaps it's time for you to call it quits. Shame on you and your partners for producing this senseless, idiotic and useless bit of a movie. A wasted 90 minutes it was!
